title: STOP Drill
introText: Practice the STOP skill during low-stress situations to build familiarity. Create your personal plan for each step so you're ready when emotions run high.

steps.title: Stop
steps.description: Freeze in place. Don't move a muscle. Stop whatever you're doing. This creates a pause before you react impulsively.
steps.placeholder: What will you do to physically stop? (e.g., freeze, put down phone, step back)...

steps.title: Take a Step Back
steps.description: Take a step back from the situation, either physically or mentally. This creates distance between you and your emotional reaction.
steps.planPrompt: Your plan for "Take a Step Back":
steps.placeholder: How will you create distance? (e.g., leave room, take a breath, count to 10)...

steps.title: Observe
steps.description: Notice what's happening inside and outside of you. What are you feeling? What are you thinking? What's the situation?
steps.placeholder: What will you observe? (e.g., body sensations, thoughts, emotions, surroundings)...

steps.title: Proceed Mindfully
steps.description: Act with awareness. Consider your goals and values. What action will be effective and in line with your values?
steps.placeholder: How will you proceed mindfully? (e.g., ask wise mind, consider consequences, choose skillfully)...
